item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v4
item.description: This is a minor update to my Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus. Changes include: Removed Encounter Movement Penalty for shields Nerfed bonuses for Races and Classes as I think they were excessive Added bonus for stealth and stunts for thieves Various minor fixes and tweaks Happy delving!

item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v3
item.description: Last week I posted about my play test of the Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus using Temple of the Moon Priests. That session was enlightening and caused me to spend a lot of time thinking about SotU and the lessons I had learned. After talking to my players and many of you online, I decided to make some changes which culminated in version 3 of the Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus.

item.title: They Came From the Sky
item.description: Note: I originaly wrote this story 4 years ago for /r/writingprompts They came from the sky in a rain of fire and on that day the gods wept for they knew that we were doomed. You are asking me to describe them so do not blame me for the dread it will instill within you. Still it will be good for you to know what your undoing will look like. Perhaps it will prepare you in some way.

item.title: The Song of Soil
item.description: We, the angry maelstroms, raged battles across our mindscapes against the ghosts of those who never really existed while seeking allies in those who had yet to come. We, the pinpoints of thought, sailed sleepily through the sea of silence each believing in the other while doubting in ourselves. We, the dreams of God, lay in wait to be awakened.

item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus
item.description: A friend of mine had been asking me for a few years now if we could play D&D. She has never played before and it got me thinking about the quickest and easiest way to introduce new players to tabletop roleplaying games. I looked at HERE’S SOME FUCKIN’ D&D by Dustin R. I really liked the simplicity of it but felt the tone and mechanics were not quite what I was looking for.
